intro: Lyonia bayamoensis, commonly known as the Bayamo lyonia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Lyonia bayamoensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes.
